review_title: A Fun and Rewarding Place to Work
pros: Love my co-workers and the work they do everyday in a challenging industry. This agency is very mission-driven and provides creative outlets for employees to recognize each other for the dedicated work they do each day.
cons: The misconceptions in the community about what hospice care is.

pros: Great colleagues, great patients, great memories.
cons: Poor pay, poor management, poor oversight.

job_title: CNA Hospice Aide in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Self scheduling is a plus for me
cons: No yearly raises at this company

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Co-workers were amazing, supportive, caring. The staff genuinely cared about the patients, even when their hand were tied. I loved being in the patient homes and facilities with them during such a complex time and knowing I was making this process easier on them.
cons: Leadership, leadership, leadership. There was a culture of not being able to offer feedback for fear of losing your job (which DID happen!). Arbor Hospice's CEO ran the company into the ground when she sold her soul for a better position, and sold out the company to the highest bidder. Such a shame that the beautiful residence for the patients is now used for bigger offices for management.

review_title: Not a good place to work.
job_title: On Call RN in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Ok pay. Mostly able to be away from nonsense at office.
cons:
Was on call nurse for Arbor for a few years. No problems. arbor was bought out by Hospice of Michigan. Number of patients with severely under treated symptoms went up dramatically. This put on call nurse in no win situation. Led to complaints. Management not interested in details of situations. Fired. 
Refused to pay me over $ 6,000 in accrued/ earned paid time off. May be part of their business plan.
Worst part was seeing gruesome under treatment of patient's symptoms. 
Really inexcusable.

job_title: Field Nurse CM in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Work on your own, set your schedule, good pay including mileage. Things may get better in time due to merge with HOM, but not looking good right now.
cons: Merger with HOM has changed this org to a top heavy bureaucratic nightmare for patients and staff. Huge turnover rate for field staff.

job_title: Administrative Support in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Great Mission! There are some wonderful professionals that are employed here.
cons: Unfortunately, this is an environment where there is little training or support from management.  There is a sense of distrust among the office staff where employees are let go with no warning.  It is very unsettling to work here.

job_title: Community Outreach Representative in Riverview, MI
pros: Provides a very compassionate, loving, and very necessary service for those with terminal illnesses. The company has been around since the 1980's.
cons: The organization is very top-heavy...too many executives and mid-level managers, wasting money that should be spent on retaining productive employees and providing additional services for patients.

review_title: Great company, hospice just was not for me!
job_title: RN Case Manager in Woodhaven, MI
pros: Good pay, extensive orientation in the classroom, great coworkers
cons: Not enough orientation in the field, almost all new employees

job_title: Registered Nurse in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Supportive and caring management! Loved my co-workers and really miss the place
cons: Like anyplace in healthcare change in inevitable and I had to move out of state.

job_title: Communications Specialist in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Very caring people
Nurses and doctors have a passion toward their work
cons:
Strange policies
Marketing manager was not supportive

job_title: RN Case Manager in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Great orientation, some very good colleagues
cons: Very negative management, management regularly rules by intimidation;daily emails regarding staff turnover.  They ask for a lot, provide a little.
